net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy

Class MOCHC

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.MOStrategy
      • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.MOCHC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.IConfigure, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstrainedMOCHC

    public class MOCHC
extends MOStrategy
    MOCHC strategy

    This strategy implements the adaptation of CHC algorithm to multi-objective optimization. MOCHC applies the same restart mechanism that CHC, but it includes a new environmental selection based on the mechanism defined in NSGA-II.

    Paper: A.J. Nebro, E. Alba, G. Molina, F. Chicano, F. Luna, J.J. Durillo, “Optimal Antenna Placement Using a New Multi-Objective CHC Algorithm". Proc. 9th annual conference on Genetic and Evolutionary Computation (GECCO'09), pp. 876-883, 2003.

    HISTORY:

    • (AR|JRR|SV, 1.0, March 2018) First release.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aurora Ramirez (AR), Jose Raul Romero (JRR), Sebastian Ventura (SV)

    Knowledge Discovery and Intelligent Systems (KDIS) Research Group: http://www.uco.es/grupos/kdis

    See Also:
    MOStrategy, Serialized Form

      • configure

        public void configure(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration settings)

        Specific parameters for MOCHC are:

        • mutator: IMutator (complex)

          The mutator to be applied.

        • distance: IDistance (complex)

          The distance to be used.

        • initial-d (integer).

          Initial distance threshold.

        • restart-d (integer).

          Distance threshold to be restarted.

        • number-of-survivors (integer).

          Number of survivors. By default, the 5% of the population size.

        • convergence-value (integer).

          Convergence value. By default, 1.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface net.sf.jclec.IConfigure
        Overrides:
        configure in class MOStrategy

      • matingSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> matingSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                                java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select individuals that will act as parents.

        In MOCHC, parents are selected using a incest prevention technique.

        Specified by:
        matingSelection in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the external population.
        Returns:
        List of selected individuals (parents).

      • environmentalSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> environmentalSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> offspring,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select survivors for the next generation.

        It performs the same procedure than NSGA-II. After that, the convergence is checked and the restart mechanism is applied, if required.

        Specified by:
        environmentalSelection in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        offspring - Individuals created by variation operators.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List of survivors.

      • updateArchive

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> updateArchive(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> offspring,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Update the archive of solutions.

        MOCHC does not uses the archive.

        Specified by:
        updateArchive in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        offspring - Individuals created by variation operators.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List containing the new member of the archive.
